content: Transform this into a web-based USMLE Step 1 study companion called AorteQ with these essential baseline features:  Authentication System: A. Welcome/Login Page:  Clean centered layout with AorteQ logo at top  "Login with your Aorteq account " header text Email input field with validation Password input field with show/hide toggle  "Forgot Password? " link (light purple, right-aligned) Primary  "Login " button (filled purple) Divider with  "Or " text  "Sign in with Google " button (white with Google logo)  "Sign in with Apple " button (black with Apple logo)  "Don't have account? Create an Account " text link at bottom All form fields should have proper validation and error states   Initial Study Plan Setup: A. Three-Step Wizard Interface:  Progress indicator at top showing 3 steps Back and Continue buttons at bottom Each step on its own page with slide transitions  Step 1: Exam Selection & Date   "Let's tailor things to your study plan " header USMLE Step 1 selector dropdown Calendar date picker for exam date Info text explaining time calculation  Step 2: Topic Selection  Multi-select grid layout showing:  Basic Sciences section:  Behavioral Science Pharmacy Biochemist Lab Epidemiology Lab Microbiology Lab   Organ Systems section:  Cardio Clinic Endocrine Clinic MSK Clinic Neuro Clinic Respiratory Clinic     Checkboxes for each topic Search/filter option for topics  Step 3: Study Schedule  Hours per day input (default: 3hr 30min) Weekly schedule selector  7-day grid showing M-Su Ability to select study days Visual indication of selected days   Automatic calculation of study plan duration Warning if schedule needs adjustment   Question Bank (QBank) Interface: A. Question View:  Progress bar at top showing position (e.g.  "Question 10/15 ") Question number and text in main area Medical case presentation format Image display area when applicable (right side) Answer options (A-E) in vertical layout Each option clearly separated Hover and selected states for options  "Eliminate Answer " toggle button Previous/Next navigation buttons Timer display (optional)  B. Session Analysis Dashboard:  Large circular progress chart showing session score Key metrics displayed prominently:  Questions completed (e.g.  "45/50 ") Accuracy percentage (70%) Average time per question (1m 30s) Total session time (0h 32m)   Performance breakdown by system/topic Bar charts showing strength/weakness areas Detailed question list with:  Correct/incorrect indicators Time spent per question Topic categorization     Progress Tracking Dashboard: A. Main Overview:  User's name and exam countdown timer Large circular progress indicator showing overall completion Weekly progress bar chart Study streak counter with visual indicators Score prediction meter showing:  Current predicted score (e.g.  "221 ") Passing score line (196) Target score line (240+)   Recent assessment scores:  Test name (e.g.  "NBME 25 ") Score achieved Date taken Trend indicators   Weekly subject breakdown Performance metrics for each topic    All features should follow these technical requirements:  Responsive web design (minimum supported width: 1024px) Clean, medical-professional aesthetic Primary color: #6366F1 (purple) Consistent spacing system Clear typography hierarchy Loading states for all async operations Error handling with user feedback Session persistence Real-time progress saving Browser compatibility: Latest Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge  This baseline version focuses on the core study experience while maintaining a professional and user-friendly interface that can be expanded with additional features in future iterations.

content.overview: Transform the existing Flutter application into a web-based USMLE Step 1 study companion called AorteQ, incorporating an authentication system, study plan setup wizard, question bank interface, and progress tracking dashboard while ensuring a clean, professional aesthetic.
new_features: Three-Step Wizard Interface for Initial Study Plan Setup
Question Bank Interface with Question View and Session Analysis Dashboard
modified_features: HomeView and HomeViewModel to accommodate new navigation and state management for the study companion features
AppView to integrate new routes and services for authentication and study plan setup
content.architectural_changes: Refactor the folder structure to better organize new features, including dedicated folders for authentication, study plan, question bank, and progress tracking. Update the state management approach to handle new user flows and data persistence.
cross_cutting_concerns: Implement a comprehensive testing strategy for new features and existing functionalities
Update documentation to reflect new features, architecture, and usage instructions
Assess performance impacts due to added features and ensure responsive design principles are followed
Enhance security measures for user authentication and data handling

content:
## Summary of Changes

### 1. Additions (➕)
- **New Components:**
  - **Authentication Features:**
    - `lib/features/authentication/login_view.dart`: New view for user login.
    - `lib/features/authentication/login_viewmodel.dart`: ViewModel managing authentication logic.
  - **Study Plan Features:**
    - `lib/features/study_plan/study_plan_view.dart`: New view for study plan setup.
    - `lib/features/study_plan/study_plan_viewmodel.dart`: ViewModel for managing study plan logic.
  - **Question Bank Features:**
    - `lib/features/question_bank/question_view.dart`: New view for question bank.
    - `lib/features/question_bank/question_viewmodel.dart`: ViewModel for question logic.
    - `lib/features/question_bank/session_analysis_view.dart`: New view for session analysis.
    - `lib/features/question_bank/session_analysis_viewmodel.dart`: ViewModel for session analysis logic.
  - **Progress Tracking Features:**
    - `lib/features/progress_tracking/progress_overview_view.dart`: New view for progress tracking.
    - `lib/features/progress_tracking/progress_overview_viewmodel.dart`: ViewModel for managing progress tracking logic.

- **New Methods:**
  - `login`, `forgotPassword` in `LoginViewModel`.
  - `selectExam`, `selectTopics`, `generateSchedule` in `StudyPlanViewModel`.
  - `analyzeSession` in `SessionAnalysisViewModel`.
  - `fetchProgress` in `ProgressOverviewViewModel`.
  
- **New Dependencies:**
  - Added dependencies for new features, including `package:stacked/stacked.dart` and `package:stacked_services/stacked_services.dart`.

### 2. Removals (➖)
- **Removed Components:**
  - Eliminated `HomeView`, `StartupView`, and their corresponding ViewModels.
  - Removed methods related to the old home and startup logic (e.g., `incrementCounter`, `showDialog`, `runStartupLogic`).

- **Deprecated Functionality:**
  - The previous navigation flow and state management logic have been replaced with new components focusing on authentication and study planning.

- **Eliminated Dependencies:**
  - Removed dependencies related to the old structure, such as `package:my_app/features/home/home_view.dart`.

### 3. Changes (🔄)
- **Modified Interfaces:**
  - Updated the main application flow to start with `LoginView`, transitioning to `StudyPlanView` upon successful authentication.
  - Refactored the app structure to accommodate new features, including authentication and study planning.

- **Updated Behaviors:**
  - The application now requires user authentication before accessing study planning and question bank features.

- **Refactored Components:**
  - The architecture has been restructured to support new features, leading to significant changes in the component structure and navigation flow.

- **Dependency Version Changes:**
  - Dependencies have been updated to reflect the new architecture and features.

### Key Areas of Focus
- **Breaking API Changes:**
  - The removal of `HomeView` and `StartupView` means any existing references to these components will break. Update any code that relies on these views.
  
- **Architectural Modifications:**
  - The application now follows a more modular approach with distinct features for authentication, study planning, question management, and progress tracking.

- **Component Structure Changes:**
  - New folder structures have been introduced for `authentication`, `study_plan`, `question_bank`, and `progress_tracking`.

- **Security Implications:**
  - The introduction of an authentication system enhances security by requiring user credentials for access.

- **Performance Impacts:**
  - The new architecture may improve performance by streamlining the flow of data and reducing unnecessary dependencies.

### Required Updates
- Update any references to removed components in your codebase.
- Ensure that authentication logic is integrated into the user flow.
- Review and test the new components to ensure they meet the application requirements.
- Adjust any existing documentation to reflect the new structure and features.

This summary provides a comprehensive overview of the changes made to the application, highlighting critical updates and potential impacts on existing functionality.
